when apt-get tells me it it cannot resolve a host, but I can ping that host...what does that mean?

it often means that your router has a little bug, which makes it go crazy when there's too many DNS (i.e. hostname resolution) requests all at once. try pointing your /etc/resolv.conf file to some other DNS server than your own home router (for example, 212.245.255.2 is a valid server)
